chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R. Ackerman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 1:07pm. INCLUDES 15CF177, 15CF279, 15CF290. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Waiver of Prelim. filed 15CF177. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information filed 15CF77. COURT proceeds with Plea. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 3 & 4 (poss drug para/repeater) 15CF177- crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 1 (bj/felony/repeater) 15CF279. State moves to DRI 15CF290-crt grants.
PLEA: GUILTY - ct 1 (manfacture/deliver/second & subsequent); ct 2 (maintain drug traffic/repeater) 15CF177; ct 2 (dc/repeater/domestic) 15CF279. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State & Defense.  COURT ORDERS: SWH 2 yrs probation, concurrent. CONDITITIONS: 6 months MCJ on ct 2; Impose & Stay 3 months jail for rule violations w/huber if eligible purusant to jail criteria; credit 69 days; AODA; SAFE Progream; Absolute Sobriety; Random UA's; 50 hours Community Service; No Contact with N.A. unlesss approved by probation or party; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; 1 Domestic Surcharge; Court Costs;  DNA Sample & Surcharge for felony.  Atty Bohn moves to remit DNA Surcharge 15CF279- COURT grants. Crt advises and defendant sign Ineligible Voting Form. Adjourned: 1:30pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Case Called: 1:30pm. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 15CF290, 15CD177, 15CF279. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Matter set on Mtn to Amend Bond on 15CF290. Arguments. COURT makes findings and denies bond modification.  DATES: Set further dates.  Adjourned: 1:37pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case Called: 9:25am. State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  Waiver of Prelim. filed.  Court questions deft as to waiver.  Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.  COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information filed.  Reading Waived.  Plea: NOT GUILTY.  Atty Bohn filed Mtn to Modify Bond. Court will not hear matter as BR 1 matter. Bond to Continue. DATES: PTC 4/8/15 2 9:20am. C: Br. 1. Adj: 9:33am.
Notice of Motion and Defense Motion for Modification of Bail - stj
Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Preliminary Hearing on April 6, 2015 at 09:20 am.

$2500.00 signature bond with first $500.00 in cash.    No contact with victim(s):  N.A. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort (Wausau PD) to retrieve any personal belongings.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 (drugs/alcohol) with day reporting.  Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
